full_text: The purpose of this demo is to teach you how to create a commercial property submission. This is a modified version of the demonstration from the Policy Center Introduction course. If you already know how to create a commercial property submission, you may skip this demo. To create a commercial property submission in the base application, you need to start from a commercial account, for example, write construction. Click the down arrow next to search. Next, click Accounts. Click the Company Name field. Type Write Construction into the Company Name field. Click the Search button. Write Construction happens to have two accounts in PolicyCenter. For the purposes of this demo, it doesn't matter which one we use. Click the Account Number link. This is the Account screen for write construction. Next, we'll see how to create a commercial property submission. Click Actions. Click New Submission. Click the Select button next to Commercial Property. This is the Policy Info screen. For the purposes of this demo, nothing needs to be changed. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission. The next step is to add a building. Click the next step is to add a building to this location. Click the Down Arrow. Click New Building. This is the New Building screen. The next step is to assign a property class code to this building. This is done via Lookup. Click the Search button. Type 0074 in the Code field. Click the Search button. There are several class code to add a search button. There are several class codes returned by this search. For the purposes of this demo, any of them may be selected. Click the Select button next to a class code. The next step is to select a coverage form. Click on the Coverage Form field. Select Building and Personal Property. The next step is to select coverages for this building. Click the Coverages tab. Unselect Business Income Coverage. Click OK to save this building. new building. This submission is ready for rating, however, first check to see if there are any underwriting issues. Click the risk analysis link. There are no underwriting issues, so click the rate button. This is the quote screen for commercial property. Note the total premium, taxes and surcharges are displayed here. No other changes are needed. Click the finish quote button. The final step is to issue the policy. Click the bind options button. Click issue policy. Click OK on the confirmation message. This completes the step.

segments.text: The purpose of this demo is to teach you how to create a commercial property submission. This is a modified version of the demonstration from the Policy Center Introduction course. If you already know how to create a commercial property submission, you may skip this demo. To create a commercial property submission in the base application, you need to start from a commercial account, for example, write construction. Click the down arrow next to search.
Next, click Accounts. Click the Company Name field. Type Write Construction into the Company Name field. Click the Search button.
Write Construction happens to have two accounts in PolicyCenter. For the purposes of this demo, it doesn't matter which one we use. Click the Account Number link.

This is the Account screen for write construction. Next, we'll see how to create a commercial property submission. Click Actions. Click New Submission. Click the Select button next to Commercial Property. This is the Policy Info screen. For the purposes of this demo, nothing needs to be changed. Click the Next button to move to the next step in the submission.

The next step is to add a building. Click the next step is to add a building to this location. Click the Down Arrow. Click New Building. This is the New Building screen. The next step is to assign a property class code to this building. This is done via Lookup. Click the Search button. Type 0074 in the Code field. Click the Search button.
There are several class code to add a search button.
There are several class codes returned by this search. For the purposes of this demo, any of them may be selected. Click the Select button next to a class code.

The next step is to select a coverage form. Click on the Coverage Form field. Select Building and Personal Property. The next step is to select coverages for this building. Click the Coverages tab. Unselect Business Income Coverage. Click OK to save this building.
new building. This submission is ready for rating, however, first check to see if there are any
underwriting issues. Click the risk analysis link. There are no underwriting issues, so click the rate
button. This is the quote screen for commercial property. Note the total premium, taxes and
surcharges are displayed here. No other changes are needed. Click the finish quote button.
The final step is to issue the policy. Click the bind options button. Click issue policy.
Click OK on the confirmation message. This completes the step.
